_data.text:
## Hello world and introductions Hi there! My name is IonuÈ› AlixÄƒndroae and welcome to my blog! The purpose of this blog is to present and showcase updated (and hopefully useful) information from inside the Software Engineering world, to provide tutorials, software development tips & tricks, code design and best practices. I live in Munich, Germany and work as a Senior Software Engineer for Esri. I'm doing full-stack development, I'm certified in [Java](https://education.oracle.com/oracle-certified-associate-java-se-8-programmer/trackp_333) and [NodeJS](https://training.linuxfoundation.org/certification/jsnad/) and I enjoy writing JavaScript code in React, as well as Python when necessary.
I am a self taught developer, my background being actually GIS, Cartography and Remote Sensing.
I'm planning to create content that will cover topics as: - Algorithms & Data Structures (using Java and/or Javascript) - JavaScript, TypeScript, NodeJS, Java and Python - Front-end development using ReactJS - Tips & Tricks to pass the Java Oracle Certified Associate, Java SE 8 Programmer exam - Tips & Tricks to pass the OpenJS Node.js Application Developer (JSNAD) exam - Back-end development & API creation (design) using NodeJS & ExpressJS or Spring Framework And finally, if you're interested in some of my older projects, you can have a look at them inside my [portofolio](https://ionutalixandroae.com) Talk to you next time! ðŸ‘‹

_data.title: Improve your blog's meta tags and make it SEO friendly
_data.author: IonuÈ› AlixÄƒndroae

toc.text: Locally using the head as a function so that you have access to data and dynamic properties

children.value: A quick search on Google and

"Search engine optimization (SEO) is the process of improving the quality and quantity of website traffic to a website or a web page from search engines. SEO targets unpaid traffic (known as "natural" or "organic" results) rather than direct traffic or paid traffic. Unpaid traffic may originate from different kinds of searches, including image search, video search, academic search, news search, and industry-specific vertical search engines."

So in a nutshell, you're optimizing your website, or blog, or even one page to make it better accessible in the search engines. More than that, you can customize the way it appears in the results or when it's getting shared across social media.
Well, if your blog or website is created using NuxtJS, same as this one, there are a few tricks to accomplish this, nothing rocket science! ðŸš€
I would like to start by recommending two articles:
one. The authors explained really well why NuxtJS is good and also bad with SEO (at least with the default settings).
It all started with this Tweet
For some reason Twitter is not recognizing some SEO properties of a page when I'm trying to share it here.
Definitely the worst part of my evening ðŸ’¢ (so far ðŸ¤£)
For some reason, I could not get Twitter (and also LinkedIn) to recognize some of my page details and properties and also to display the image in a nice sharing card. ðŸ™„
As any other good developer, I started directly by tweaking the code here and there, yolo ðŸ¤
Then went to Stack Overflow ðŸ˜–
After carefully reading those two articles and some other resources, it looks like the
properties in my pages were either incorrect, invalid or not present at all.
Nuxt lets you define all default
tags for your application inside the
file using the head property. This is very useful for adding a default title and description tag for SEO purposes or for setting the viewport or adding the favicon.
You can also add titles and
for each page by setting the head property inside your script tag on every page.
as a function so that you have access to data and dynamic properties
This is what did the trick in my case, for each new blog page with dynamic content, dynamic title, image & description.

Having all the properties set and working ended up with a very nice preview of my pages when shared across social media.
What's even more helfpul is the fact that these sites have special pages where you can test and validate your updates and your meta properties. Some of these validators even offer suggestions on which tags must be added or updated.
Just put your page URL here and preview the card result
I hope this 10 minute read will help you save one hour of debugging (ðŸ˜‚) and will assist you set up your webpages SEO and social media optimized right away!
